title: It doesn't have a sense of unity.
text: The beginning of the movie was good but the middle and last half turned boring. It was cool action but honestly, I couldn't understand the story.

title: Black Widow: "Die hard" on Marvel Path
text: Jeez when i first time saw this movie trailer I wasn't sure that this is going to hype me that well. But, after saw the film it was changing me at all.. "Is it the best marvel movie?" Obviously not for me.. "But is it different?" Yes it is.. Well in the beginning they're add some opening credit that Marvel movies infrequently do that, but in this movies they add it out. And after that the performance are nailed it. From middle to ending i can saw potential from Florence Pugh that obviously she remarkable actress, and add David Harbour also make me laugh at many scenes though. Alright now move on to minus point from this movie, Well first it's obviously too late too realise the movie in 2021 (goddamn it pandemic) because this movie will get the hype in 2020 when natasha died on endgame that actually release in 2019.. (Spoiler even most of you already know it) so most of us have the sympathy of the character, second the movie obviously not focus on the main character (Natasha Romanoff) but I think they're focus on Yelena Belova which is Florence Pugh (Because the contract on Scarlett Johansson end in this film), and the last one I think there is too much CGI on this film that sometime makes me feel illogical to realize it out. Well I think it wasn't that bad to see the film its obviously great to a person who miss watching marvel movies Score:8/10.

title: Nothing special
text: Really not nice movie.

title: Better than I expected.
text: I enjoyed this movie. It's a little clumsy at times, but I genuinely think this outrage towards the movie is ridiculous. It's pretty campy at some moments and requires you to suspend your disbelief, but the characters were surprisingly compelling. I really do like the dynamic of Natasha's family. Marvel movies tend to follow a formula and I don't think this deviated too much. With that being said, I knew what to expect and was actually kinda surprised. Not every joke works and sometimes you'll be asking "why does everybody have a one liner prepared " but just remembered you're watching a Marvel movie. Despite that, I laughed more than I thought. This element honestly worked in Black Widow's favor as a character, humanizing her and adding depth. This is not a back story , but it tells you what you need to know about her.Her character before this movie was generally pretty lackluster, even with the small moments that really worked for her. I think we could mostly agree her character was mostly one dimensional and came off as more of an obligation to a trope, rather than an autonomous human with personal motives and morals and goals. This movie changes that, even if you think Natasha is not that unique of a character (which I'd probably disagree with).The cinematography was different from most Marvel movies but in an honestly pretty stunning way, at least when it came to the lighting and the more ethereal nature shots. CGI was not amazing but it was pretty good.I gotta commend this movie for actually fleshing out Black Widow's character. I actually feel something for her now. Her story is honestly pretty cool and I did not expect the movie to get so violent and visceral but it did and it usually served the narrative. Some moments are just cheesy explosions that really only make you ask "how is anyone still alive in this movie" but you really just gotta suspend your disbelief, it is a superhero movie.This movie is pretty good, better than I expected. The movie wasnt perfect and there's a few things I'd change but I'm generally quite pleased. Definitely check it out, and be prepared for a little extra blood and stupid action-movie stuff like sniping on the wing of an airplane. Refreshing, and satisfying.

title: Ebert is my goto critic ... but not foolproof!
text: Yes, it did have a story ... but the movie lives of action scenes that are too long (I fast forward), rather than exploring a more attractive "family" saga. The idea to make a series out of this is .... Oh well, I won't speak I'll of the "Avengers".Happy to have seen Scarlett and her companions ... the script was a desaster.

title: There is something really wrong with people their abilty to enjoy good mocvies nowadays
text: This one of the best action films ever made. The cast is incredible, the fight choreography as good as it gets, character development on point, laugh out loud funny, jaw dropping visuals, really imposing villain and a constant rush of being hunted.And still people are pretending like they've watched an Ed Wood movie.Sorry but, get yourself checked if you're in that camp because I have the feeling that ain't healthy. Being critical is absolutely fine but looking for stuff to hate when something is this entertaining is downright unhealthy.I am not sure if any other action movie in 2021 will top this even though I am really looking forward to No Time to Die.Just bloody enjoy this spectacular movie!

title: Really?
text: Could not finish watching . Ok I tried to watch this movie , but could not finish it. Sorry Marvel. I tried. Also 150 why such an arbitrary number ? Blah blah blah .

title: The bad guys read the script
text: When the bad guys always find the protagonists, no matter where they hide. I control my disdain by reminding myself that DC movies are based on COMICS. They can get away with anything!Ths movie was exellent entertainment, watched it twice.

title: Just extremely boring
text: I did not know if I want to watch it to the end. Just wasted time. There were really interesting Marvell movies before... This is not the one of them.

title: Great Fun
text: I don't know why there are so many terrible reviews here. I thought this movie was a lot of fun. It had heart, action, adventure, and killer special effects. I had the pleasure of watching it in HDR and it was a stunning film to behold.It is true that Pugh stole the show. She had the best lines and was the funniest. Scarlett was fantastic as usual, and kept the Avengers flame lit throughout.I'm not sure if this strays from comic book canon or not, as I've never read the comics. But as a movie buff and MCU fan, it was a great ride.Be sure to catch the post-credit scene, as with most MCU films.

title: Not Marvel-lous, but VERY Hollywood.
text: I only made it to the 40th minute, this snapshot of the movie consisted of = CGI chase scene, OTT fight scene, CGI chase scene, OTT fight scene, CGI chase scene.... If you look very closely you can see a pattern emerging. I noped out of the rest before seeing if the mind-numbing pattern continued for the rest of the 135 minute run time before my brain turned completely to mush.

title: Great action movie
text: Action packed from beginning to end with a plot that rivals some bond films. Highly recommended if you're even remotely a fan of the Marvel cinematic universe or espionage films in general.

title: Not as bad as they would have you believe
text: I think the one thing that I've learned is not to take too seriously other peoples views on movies. For a start if I'm watching an MCU movie I'm going to expect CGI, fight scenes and people doing stuff that we mere mortals can't do. If I wanted a serious true life story I wouldn't be watching this but if you want a fun couple of hours where belief can be suspended for a while and my expectations are for explosions, people getting bashed, and a few funny lines along the way then this is for you. Okay it's not Hamlet but we learnt a bit more about Natasha and I can see her 'sister' becoming an Avenger in later movies and I think she would do a good job. Don't think about it too deeply. Just sit back and enjoy it for what it is.

title: Pretty boring movie
text: It was very confusing and boring. I actually fell asleep in the middle of the movie, which never happens to me! It was that boring... Acting is very mediocre, the characters are very superficial... This is by far the worst Marvel movie ever.

title: Not a great movie but a fun one and a good time
text: The character interactions are really what makes this movie, the plot is kind of paced weird and the villain is weak and under utilized but where the movie shines is it's action scenes and it's character interactions. And it's writing of female characters is the best to come out of marvel so far. I'd say defiantly watch.

title: What a STINK BURGER!!!
text: First off, This movie was too long for what is was.The plots do not have a rewarding payoff, & or not explained. Example in most scenes you are dropped in the events that are happening, with little to no explanations of what is going on. I know less now about the back story of the avengers & or black widow now that I've seen this movie. The cut scene at the end one has to make a lot of assumptions in order for it to make sense.

title: Enjoyable, 8/10, with questionable choices
text: The movie is after Sokovia, Natasha goes underground.It was interesting to see her backstory and family, it is the backbone of the movie.Every superhero movie is just as good as the villain.Taskmaster and the red room organization was a good idea, but after watching the movie i feel like that there was a lot of potential for giving Taskmaster a more detialed backstory becasue you dont really connect with the motivation therefore you feel the character empty.There is a lot of action in the movie and those scenes are top quality.The twists in the movie are somewhat predictable but the twist with Taskmaster is the only part what is questionable for me.Overall i think it was a good MCU movie for enjoying a saturday afternoon, helped you know more about Black Widow and the end credit scene was connected to the Captain America and The Winter Soldier series.

title: What a mess
text: What an absolute dog's breakfast of a movie. Rambling incoherent plot - the bad guy wants control of the world but so what? For what ends? Just vapid, unintelligible nonsense, with a few points awarded for stylish set pieces.Meh, with extra side helpings of meh with a meh glaze.

title: Fun avengers movie
text: Scarlet Jo and Florence Pugh looked like they had a fun time making the movie. The action was Jason Bourne good. The bad guy was more sleezy than horrific. There's a lot of emotion included especially with the sisters. The character development is there which is sometimes missing in MCU movies. Also the locations and scenery were fantastic much props to the crew.

title: I was expecting better
text: After all the hype around the movie and really enjoying the character in previous movies I was expecting more. A could chunk of the scenes were a direct rip off of James Bond car chases and Kung Foo Movies leaving little for character development. I don't think this movie had an original thought in the plot as the plot seems to be ripped off from other movies. The acting was good given what they had to work with.

title: As average as it gets
text: I feel kinda sorry for Scarlet Johansson who get "her own movie" after the entire MCU was pretty much done with everything relevant to her character. It shows.

title: 100 million for this?
text: Yes that's what Scarlett got paid for this. And it's boooooring, bbbboooring, BORING!I was expecting an action packed film, dynamic and with a comic book style visual narrative but the story is just boring. And why put Olga Kurylenko's head on a dude's body? Task Master suit looks cheap and her mask is just trash. Looking at a deformed Olga on a dude's body is the worst thing I've seen on a movie ever.They ruined so many things on this movie. I used to love Scarlett as an actress but now I don't want ever watch a film of her again ever.

title: good for one view, but WHAT HAPPENED IN BUDAPEST?
text: Average flick, don't worry if you miss it, but if you're a Marvel fan it's worth one watch. Speaking of Marvel fans, even casual ones will be familiar with Clint and Natasha bantering "We remember Budapest very differently". I wouldn't bet the farm that this film would pay off on that wonderful tease, and when they made a point of how the characters pronounce Budapest, and the movie spent most of its time there, I couldn't wait! But no. No payoff. Nothing. It was good for a popcorn flick but Marvel's best? This ain't. The best thing I can say about it is the nearly-all-female cast and the constant, well deserved pot-shots at masculinity that are peppered throughout. But as another reviewer noted, it all just feels so forced.

title: Carried by the main cast
text: It's a brutal spy film with a lot of people getting shot, blown up or stabbed, but the cutesy PG-13 rating makes a lot of the violence feel artificially 'clean' and neutered, cowardly. In fact, for the first half of the movie, 'artificial' was a good descriptor for a lot of aspects, such as the arbitrary justifications for some of the fights, the occasionally distracting, underbaked CGI or the somewhat disconnected soundtrack.That being said, Scarlett Johansson, Florence Pugh, Rachel Weisz and David Harbor are all on point; their characters have a delightful, engaging chemistry and there's both a surprising humor and a deep sorrow to their dynamic as a quasi-real family. It is here that lies the pleasant surprise of the movie, its greatest strength: giving Black Widow some more character development, deepening her profile as a character and leaving a post-Ultimatum legacy for her and the characters connected to her.I began watching this movie with a frustrated, cynical outlook, expecting a by-the-numbers cardboard flick of the Great Marvel Machinery, yet I found a heart in this story. It takes a while to show, and it is occasionally obfuscated, but it's definitely there.

title: Don't waste your time!
text: One thing for sure, the producers would've wished they didn't pay the money for it! The story is ok, but the script, acting and graphics were just bad and not worth of a MCU movie!

title: Yawn
text: More of the save the world ,things blowing up, confusing plot, overblown CGI, lousy acting, no originality, super hero Gahr-bahge.

title: Pew
text: What a badly edited snorefest...despite great action sequences...incongrous?... I'd have thought so until I saw this. I'm glad the titular character sued disney...she'll need all the cash she can save after this...everybody else outshined her acting wise. Maybe a career as a sleep therapist....

title: What a huge let down
text: The story was ok, their attempts at comedy were extremely cringe and totally unnecessary. The story wasn't too bad fighting was decent but why I gave this such a low rating was the end. How could they end a movie like that and not explain anything. Lazy writing! It seems Disney is starting to get pretty good at hiring lazy writers.

title: Marvel chic flick
text: How disappointed to see marvel choose a lessser marvel character into a chick flick., now I love marvel however black widow has no powers and is merely a great gymnast.

title: Cares too much about its audience.
text: The movie feels self concious about its character. Trying to prove she's worthy of the title she shares with literal gods, it relies in unrestrained bombastic action, full things blowing up or crashing (using a not so good cgi), while the old good hand to hand combat one would come to expect from this movie is both brief and lacking.In the narrative department the movie gives you scenes full of emotional dialogue (along with jokes and exposition is the only type of dialogue I've found) with no build up to back it up. Why should anyone care about or even believe this "family" when they've only seen it for two minutes before cutting to a car chase.These wounds just deepen with a soundtrack who knows nothing of restraint, selling scenes with regular dialogue as pivotal moments or killing the tension in otherwise good action scenes that sound the same at the beginnig, when nothing has happened yet, and at the end, when everything's going down.Wrapping up with the negatives, taksmaster is extremely underused (I don't really mind changes from it's comicbook counterpart), and the movie would benefit greatly from cutting entirely the Morocco scene (too many reasons to comment here). And don't get me started on the comments, jokes and references aimed specifically for the audience, for you to feel good because "you got it", taking you out of the story.To end in a positive note; Johansson, Harbour and Pugh give tremendous charisma to their characters. Red guardian's character is BRILLIANTLY constructed through subtle action and not exposition, even if he migth be too much of a comic relief for some. The movie has some really good moments.

title: Florence Pugh made this movie watchable
text: Title says it all. I need more Florence Pugh in my life. What a hot little minx. Other then that, the movie was okay. Some funny parts with Red Guardian and good action throughout bit kind of disappointing.

title: Boring
text: Pugh (sister) was only decent performance, really boring, pointless movie.

title: üòí
text: The only thing I can offer is that emoji in my title and a 5 star rating. If the emoji gets cleared think of it as that GIF meme of Ryan Reynolds doing a face palm in utter disappointment. Is it watchable, yes. Am I telling you don't watch it? No please do so if your interested in closing all of the angles of the MCU. But in my honest opinion this movie was hot garbage; perhaps that was why Hawkeye went direct to a TV series. And this quite frankly should have been a made for TV movie.

title: Leaves you feeling DIRTY
text: Totally left with an elderly male sexual predator vibe. So gross. No depth to villain other than being gross. Bad CGI fight transitions on actors. Underwhelming for Marvel; pretty disappointed. Was really looking forward to this after the winter soldier/falcon series let down.

title: Boring
text: Over hyped PR... film was very lack luster, was expecting a lot more, especially with young jovovich breakout role.

title: Worst MCU movie so far
text: To begin - I've never been a fan of Black Widow but I tried to keep an open mind when watching this movie. First - the chase/fight scenes were numerous and went on far too long. That's ok for the final battle but the ones leading up to it should have been edited for maximum impact. I found myself not caring at all about the outcome of each.Second - no, wait, still the first point - because of the numerous fight scenes there was little room for a true exploration of the family dynamic and the bonds that existed.This movie does not stack up to the other MCU movies and does not bear repeat viewing.

title: Carried by lovable actors but even they can't overcome the silliness
text: After two years without a movie, this was a disappointing "below-average" Marvel experience. Questions I have: What's with the over the top action scenes that look like something from Fast and Furious? Natasha will never die when she can simply jump out of any window and always find a railing grab. Or hang from a helicopter and pluck people with seemingly super-human strength.If this weren't a Marvel movie (which it doesn't need to be since it does nothing to expand the overall MCU story), I'd probably give it a 3 or 4.

title: Special effects are terrible
text: Very bad special effects. To the point it all looks super fake. Crazy. I think this movie js way overrated.Not really worth it. Unless you want to play it for a 5 year old.

title: Surprisingly bad
text: To keep it concise - superficial villains, underwhelming story, unusually noticable VFX hiccups.Good acting by the main cast and partially impressive fight choreos cannot save this loveless spinoff. Particularly towards the end the movie disintegrates in scenes which actually made my friend and I facepalm.

title: Why bother?
text: Unlike all the other avenger films I turned it off after 20 minutes because my take away food arrived. The next day i stuck it back on for a bit and then was distracted by a cat in my garden. The next day I thought I'd watch the rest of it and have just paused it to write this review. Not a good start to a film I was looking forward to. Too little too late.

title: Not good at all
text: Just saw this on Disney+ and have to say it's really bad. The storyline is poor, the acting at times really bad and the jokes are mainly not very funny. I think this film should have been made 5-10 years ago after the first Avengers movie came out like all the other standalones. Where it fits in the timeline is confusing and lots of it doesn't make much sense. I had really high hopes for this movie as Black Widow was one of my favourite characters but this was not good at all. It's probably time to just leave it be Marvel. You made some great movies (Iron Man, Thor, Civil War, Infinity War, Endgame).... Don't do a Simpsons and destroy your legacy.

title: BORING
text: This film is B-O-R-I-N-G AF! I barely even remember what happened except for the middle of the film where barely anything happened except for bad comedy between a reconnected family. Really boring and just... a lame Marvel movie.

title: Action Movies Turning Into Video Games
text: It started with way too much drama and turned into a video game. Kill the man, and the next labyrinth, kill the man and the next level, an armour upgrade etc... Blonde girl was under a bit spotlight that is because obviously that they will make a follow up movie. It doesn't worth of your 2 hours really.

title: Black
text: A story that was not at the level...poor in terms of action, knowing that the Avengers company focuses a lot on action and visual effects.

title: Not upto Marvel Level.
text: Quality of Story, ACTION, Cillian all below average. Injustice to Scarlet.

title: Bland.
text: It wasn't that bad, it was just bland, didn't like the adaption of Taskmaster but it fit with the story, and some writing was stupid. The post credit scene set up a lot. I'm excited to see what happens. I rate it a 5.5/10.

title: Well..
text:
In marvel films Black Widow always seemed like a underdeveloped character for me. Quite boring I might say; yes, she's a spying badass assassin, but although rightfully so, overshadowed by Thunder Gods, angry green dudes and what not. It never seemed like she had a platform as a character in this messy circus. Until this was announced.. and oh boy they did not deliver.First of all - character played by miss Pugh is far more interesting than all the baggage we got for Romanoff over the years, and this was the time to deliver on her part; unfortunately they did more of the same.Second - the story. What is this the 90's? Generic antagonist - I am this and that cause I am evil. Pointless, stupid, intern level writing."I will take over the world with all these women soldiers!"
Why?Third. I know this is a marvel film, but there is no real quintessential character development at all./ ** Sorta spoiler here
Yes, there are sentimental moments of fake families reunite and children being abused for their exceptional predisposition to combat skills or whatever.**/
Only thing we get is supporting actress miss Pugh having moments ... lets just say moments, that lead to absolutely nothing story wise.Fourth. Visuals were great. Combat was pretty good.

title: The Winter Soldier 2.0
text: U wanna know how to destroy a villain? Just watch Black Widow! Its not a Natasha Romanoff solo movie, its a movie made to introduce the next Black Widow.The movie could also be called The Winter Soldier 2.The highlights of the movie are Red Guardian and the post-credit scene.

title: How can this movie be so blah?
text: It has Scarlett Johansson, a bunch of other great women, a thousand writers and it sucks. The plot is so thin and nothing is based on cause and effect, it's more like, "oh we need to justify this incredibly oblique polite point so let's throw this exposition in now." Seriously, this is what counts as a Marvel movie now? I guess there are no more great Marvel movies.

title: It Could Have Been Worse
text: It could have been worse. Not much. The story line was choppy. The bad guy had no character, just your generic "I'll do anything to rule the world" guy. Stan is over in his grave. Lots of action, good actors, that's about it.

title: Average Marvel flick
text: Another fairly entertaining, but mostly disposable half-assed Marvel film. Perhaps it could have been a hit if it was released a decade ago, but these formulaic superhero flicks are definitely starting to grow outmoded. It's never terrible but just too naively written and visibly lazy in execution. Yet, I feel that it's the flaws that made the film so enjoyable to my taste.The usual Marvel template gets updated with a bunch of spy thriller stereotypes in the veins of "Mission: Impossible" and a beating heart for family affairs that made me inevitably think of "The Incredibles" or even "Spy Kids". The ensemble cast has good chemistry, and, despite the emotional moments falling terribly flat and the gags feeling like they were written in the 90s, watching the characters interact was more than pleasant. The Russian accents coming and going for no apparent reason bothered me at first, but after hearing Ray Winstone's, I just stopped caring about it altogether.Needless to say, the action scenes are always fun to watch. I just wish they would stop relying on confusing fast cuts and distracting CGI flourishes, though. I was actually surprised to read so many names in the special effects department as some of the chroma key shots were absolutely atrocious (the one with Yelena getting blasted away by an explosion deserves special mention). Still, the most distracting thing of the whole movie was Natasha's smart solution to resist the villain's pheromones, possibly the most WTF moment since the infamous "rubber lips" in "Batman & Robin".

title: Too little too late
text: Join ScarJo as she battles Marvel audiences for some form of relevancy. Horrible film; decent one liners, ok performances. But not needed nor memorable. Inane "girl power" action that while stellar feels too little and too late to be anything but really a vehicle to introduce Pugh the new canonical Black Widow for the upcoming Thunderbolts film. The third act is easily one of the worst of PHASE 4 in general honestly.

title: Florence Pugh gets the 5 stars
text: Movie should have been placed linearly where it was relatable, for starters.Florence Pugh was a revelation, never seen her before. Didnt expect Scarlett Johannson would ever be updated, but she was, and totally.....Not overly into super hero movies, but always liked the black widow character, and what Ms Johannson brought to it, but this should have been called Black Widows Little Sister (Is Totally Owning)

title: HARD TO FILL THE BOOTS
text:
After Figthing a titan, it became clear the next marvel movie will have big shoes to fill.Black widow, wasn't it, black widow should have been another Disney+ 3part seriesAt least have one episode introducing the family
The next episode introducing the new black widow and then a final episode of Natasha and her quest.After watching the movie I kept wondering who was the black widow.Was the villain even necessary.I'm glad I watched the other serieses otherwise the cutscene would have felt weird like how thanos changed appearance in every cutscene.

title: Reality is a bit overpowering compared to this film
text: She wants to get back at the powers that be. That sounds good in theory, but the reality is that you win at all costs. You do whatever is required. It is dark. It is cold. It is at the expense of lives. It is at the expense of your feelings. It is at the entire expense of yourself. Period.No matter what it does to you as the protagonist, your emotions are forfeit. There is only the mission. If you want to cry about it, maybe you shouldn't have participated in the first place. Maybe that is the fault of your parents or whatever, but that changes the facts in no way whatsoever.War is hell. Welcome to reality. Pretty much everyone understands that from birth. And don't be na√Øve, everything is war.

title: You don't need to watch this one.
text: This character should've stayed dead after Endgame.Scarlett earned an extra star after buttfuxking Disney with that lawsuit, but yeah I made myself watch this for the sake of giving it a chance and I'll never need to see it again.It's not awful just extremely forgettable. Who at Disney decided to give the most boring character in the MCU their own standalone?

title: Horribly dull and boring
text: Not much to say. Boring plot, useless in the MCU, boring dialogues, boring characters, zero tension because it's a prequel.Skip it, you'll save 2h15 of your life.

title: Discrimination for Black Widow
text: I was really looking forward to watch this movie, especially for The Black Widow. But after watching it I can clearly see the discrimination done by Marvel if we compare with the Captain Marvel movie. Black widow was with the Marvel since Ironman 2. Appeared in Avengers franchise with some less notable contribution and footage. But when the character got chance to flourish herself Marvel pulled the chain again. In contrary, Captain Marvel got much better storyline than her. In my opinion this is a discrimination. The end of the story could really use some more logical actions.

title: Good acting couldn't save the bad writing
text: The movie had good acting. But the stern was very meh. The jokes mostly felt forced.It was probably the second worth movie in the MCU behind Iron man 2. Up to that point at least. Eternals was definitely worse though. So it's not the 3rd worse movie.

title: Meh. Really not very interesting
text: The best Black Widow scene in the MCU films was her 'interrogation' in the first Avengers movie.Nothing in this film comes close to that cleverness and humor.Alexei does a decent job as the comic relief.The whole movie is basically just setting up future films with the Yelena Belova (Florence Pugh) character.

title: We love Scarlett Johansson but...
text: We love Scarlett Johansson but the story was not really impactful. The only thing that hyped us was the last fallen scene.

title: Perhaps the worst MCU film to date
text: Where do I even begin with this one. My main takeaway from the film is that it was really boring. This may have been one of the only MCU films (along side with the first two Thor films) where I nearly fell asleep. Another bad thing about this film is the CGI, and the crazy part is that a film like Black Widow (a film much more grounded in reality than 99% of the rest of the MCU films) does not require that much CGI. I would definitely skip this film if you're watching a marathon of MCU films.

title: Not bad
text: It's a shame Disney decided to breach Scarlett's contract since the whole movie left parts of her story out that could have been explored in future movies.

title: Better than I expected but I wasn't expecting much
text: The action scenes were cool (except for a few parts where the heros should have clearly died even in mcu universe and they were fine) and David harbour was great as usual but it was just an "ehh" kind of movie.

title: total crap
text: Boring as hell and totally 100% predictable! I mean it was bad, who ever wrote this needs $#@! Canned immediately!

title: If you like CGI and fast action...
text: Just another non stop action movie with a lot of CGI effects in a superhero environment. And don't get me wrong some superhero movies I really liked but this one is all about the action. The character development is poor, all figures are kinda bland and the villain is your typical guy but this time surrounded by women fighters.I made it till the end but a forgettable movie that takes itself too seriously and hence won't make my collection of hero movies.

title: Worst Marvel film until now
text: I'm very disappointed because I like the character. But the story was very poor, full of logical flaws.The action was so exaggerated that it was boring to watch. Not worth watching.

title: Super extra exaggerated action scenes
text: I really don't understand the latest tendency to ruin potentially great films with action scenes that are so exaggerated that just don't feel right as they are so unreal... It's like they are doing what was done to 007 for many years... Didn't they learned with the mistakes of the past? Marvel studios did great films but this and Aquaman are just mediocre...

title: Very ordinary
text:
Very simple, very ordinary, a complete waste of time..It always continues with the same action, the story is poorly constructed...
With so many similar movies, we have to make a difference, the movie was a disappointment.

title: Free from the library is OK.
text: I'll pay more than five or six bucks for this is not.Had some good moments but there are far better superhero movies.I like the woman focus for a change, but several plot holes and General unbelievability, make this an middling superhero show.

title: Pointless snooze
text: I was bored with this film already fifteen minutes in, and it didn't change during the whole thing. Ridiculous dialogues, such pathetic attempts at humor and what was even the point of this entire film? A complete waste of my time, and a shame Natasha's last hurrah amounted into that. Two thumbs down.

title: Utter garbage
text: Absolutely disgusting garbage movie with no plot.Just some CGI and then occasionally a new character shows up with a stupid line.This movie is an utter disgrace and an example of Disney money making machine destroying the legacy of a legendary Marvel character - Black Widow.

title: Do We really need a movie on Side kicks
text: Tired of weird scientific project stories. Marvels if you need to make movies on side kicks you better come out with better scripts. This one does not cut any marks.

title: Marvel but not marvel
text:
Watched the movie and felt like nothing is connecting...
The movie was bad and boring and not like other marvel movies.I think after they pulled out the Loki series and Wanda vision and falcon they could atleast try make something good as the series.

title: Russian bad guys played by British actors still happening in 2021
text: I found this all very contradictory and I'll getbwhat I didn't like out of the way first;Despite being quite modern with its strong female cast and characters it is also very old with evil Russians who live in squalor amongst pigs (literally in this case), drink heavily, don't shave and don't wash etc.The attempts at dry, quick-wit comments is akin to 30 year old James Bond titles which they seem to allude to without shame which really doesn't work well with a Disney production trying to plug family values while killing and blowing up dozens of people.The story and characters lacked depth to the point that a few people (fewer than 6) left the showing I was at and didn't come back.Personally, the most disappointing thing for me was the amount of explaining the characters were doing for the sake of the audience - it came across as if Disney/Marvel were worried about how dumb their audiences might be.On to the good points...While still very action driven, they seem to be learning their lesson about dragging out prolonged action scenes, although characters do keep coming across conveniently discarded guns, parachutes and the like. The music score was pretty good. There was a nice blend of some young/new and old actors.On balance they did pretty well for a Marvel/Disney production and it will probably keep the fans who are familiar with the rest of the franchise happy. Although if you take it as a stand-alone film and measure it against wider cinema then it's pretty weak and unmemorable.

title: Not great but it's ok
text:
The story was great I liked it but they couldn't put the things together well. It's funny and action packed. But Apparently it did not live upto the expectations as we all know.The direction and cinematography was bad in my opinion.......
Did not expect this from marvel but because of the story its just okay and "watchable".COULD HAVE DONE BETTER.

title: Mediocre
text: I was quite excited for a Black Widow movie. An avengers movie with a whole different take .. dabbling less in the good vs. Evil - and more in the grey area, where the goals justify the means.But what did i get. A movie that satisfied the "summer blockbuster" requirements .. in a bad way. A flat story with fairly one dimensional characters (what a crime! .. a black widow movie with one dimensional characters!!) - a story that offered good vs. Evil .. and a protagonist that showed very little conflict when it came to "doing what needs to be done .. or does it?"One also often says that a hero is only as good as the villain .. and this villain was - boring. Boring and unsurprising. The villain was not even a villain! (that is a villain that has his agenda that the viewer can understand)Maybe the problem is that there is little more than Thanos for Marvel at that time. It is hard to "escalate" from a point where half the universes¬¥ population was exterminated.All in all, i was very disappointed with the movie. It was not "boring" per se .. but it felt like a lazy effort at best.

title: I know they were all train the same way but no one should have been able to even come close to Natasha
text: With all the fighting and battling the Natasha has done none of the other female agents should really come close to her in a fight because she's taking on superpowered villains our whole last 10 years of her life so a couple female agents and even the villain really I mean she should be able she really should have been able to kill any of them I mean she was going to toe with thanos's soldiers so a couple of female russian spies that aren't souped up shouldn't Cakewalk but instead they make it because they will train the same way that they're close to her when it should have been too completely different universes also we've been really cool to have cap make a cameo. In the beginning to like maybe help her out or you know since especially they were the last two that were on the run.

title: I was expecting better
text: Not that it's worth going to the movies, but not even to the projector. A movie watching on a strong TV. It's almost a comedy. They couldn't get much out of it.

text: I just watched o movie full of unlinked scenes to the overall story. Sorry to have this as a Marvel Movie...As a Marvel fan, I could bot get any attachment to the characters, even to black widow, who looks very different then Marvel other series..

title: Vanilla, generic, meh....
text: It seems like that Disney had an idea for the 6 or 7 set pieces that litter the movie but no idea how to tie them together and make it funny, compelling or that there was any peril to any of the characters at any stage.Too little, too late with soooo many plot conveniences.

title: $30.00 for premier access!?!
text: All I can say is I recommend NEVER EVER pay 30 dollars for this. CGI was fairly decent HOWEVER the titular character sucked. Wasn't even a story about the main character-all the other characters carried the main character and thus was really about them not nat.

title: My review
text: Haven't watched all of it only a little it's good so far.

title: Action overload but also has some humorous, quieter scenes.
text: Really the main reason we watched this movie is for Scarlett Johansson, we go all the way back to her "Horse Whisperer" role in 1998. She doesn't disappoint but also all the other cast members are outstanding. It has all the mandatory, implausible and impossible action, including some chase scenes and crashes that no one in reality could survive. But hey!! It's a fantasy movie and overall very enjoyable.It starts in Ohio in 1995, where we meet what appears to be a typical suburban family of four, with two young girls, until "dad" tells all "It is time to go, do what we have talked about." They make a thrilling escape to Cuba in a pre-hidden airplane, then on to Europe and Russia.The movie soon jumps forward 21 years and Natasha (Johansson) has become Black Widow working with the Avengers. And then it develops from there.My wife and I watched it at home on DVD from our public library. We were entertained and that is all you ask for in this type of movie.JAN 2023 update: Just watched it again on BluRay after 9 months and I enjoyed it even more the second time.

title: GACK. Nowhere near as good as the character deserved.
text: Nowhere near as good as the character deserved. Yet, this film was not the train wreck that I was expecting. For every wrong turn or poorly crafted element there seemed to be two positives. In other words, two steps forward and one step back. While that formula isn't the most pleasant journey, it gets you where you need to go. That's the definition of this movie at this late time... a satisfactory film that delivered Natasha's back story in a proficient manner. It's not completely soulless but leaning heavily in that direction. The action isn't noteworthy but it's not pathetic either.The more you digest the film, the more middle of the road it gets as there are some things to like and some things to roll your eyes at and hate. The Taskmaster for instance is an absolutely pathetic villain. The main villain pulling the strings was a straight up "mustache twirling" evil guy for the sake of evil. He had all the depth of an Austin Powers villain or an over-the-top bad guy Liam Neeson would kill at the end of one of his movies. Another huge negative was that everything had to be spelled out as if the audience had the intellect of a small child. They left no dots to be connected at all, often telegraphing every turn. It was predictable to the point of nausea. Also, the "mother" character delivers another female antagonist in this phase of the MCU that commits horrible crimes and acts and never answers for them at all.I did like the supporting cast of Yelana and the Red Guardian. It seems to me that they passed the Black Widow baton properly from one sister to another. I did enjoy the call backs to past films.Overall, cutting it slack for what has come before might be its saving grace. Otherwise, it's completely middle of the road in every way. To say it delivers "see spot run" writing and below average direction is an understatement.
